properties.short description: Battle at Nocera Between Roger II and Robert II
properties.description: The siege of Nocera is brought to an end by pitched battle between Robert II and Roger II on 25 July 1132.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
Robert II, Prince of the Capuans
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Aversa is Attacked and Destroyed by Roger II
properties.description: Roger II advances on Aversa with his army and lays waste to it.
properties.people:
Roger II, King
John, Emir
Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alife
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Counterattack against the Pisans at Fratte
properties.description: Roger II caught news of the attack on Amalfi and met the Pisans at Fratte.  A pitched battle ensued in which Roger defeated them and drove the Pisans back to the sea.
properties.source:
The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
Skinner, Patricia.  Medieval Amalfi and its Diaspora, 800-1250 (Oxford University Press, 2013)
